which lay sixty-six miles off on the line of Kutiizov's retreat. If he reached Znaim before the French, there would be great hope of saving the army; to let the French forestall him at Znaim meant the ex- posure of his whole army to a disgrace such as that of Ulm, or to utter destruction. But to forestall the French with his whole army was impossible. The road for the French from Vi- 
enna to Znaim was shorter and better than the road for the Russians from Krems to Znaim.
